thread.title: Emmerdale fans in tears as Aaron Dingle and Robert Sugden finally get married... in a garage - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Emmerdale fans in tears as Aaron Dingle and Robert Sugden finally get married... in a garage - Mirror Online

author: Nicola Agius
title: Emmerdale fans in tears as Aaron Dingle and Robert Sugden finally get married... in a garage - Mirror Online
text:
Emmerdale fans in tears as Aaron Dingle and Robert Sugden finally get married... in a garage The couple are finally husband and husband Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Emmerdale: Faith Dingle ruins the big wedding Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Emmerdale fans were in tears as they watched the wedding of the year unfold. 
After an extremely rocky road, Aaron Dingle [Danny Miller)] and Robert Sugden [Ryan Hawley] finally became husband and husband in tonight's episode. 
But in true Robron style, the couple decided to go against tradition and exchange their vows in a very unusual place - a garage. 
It was Aaron's idea after Faith Dingle's brush with the law almost ruined the couple's big day. Emmerdale fans were in tears as they watched the wedding of the year unfold (Photo: ITV) 
Despite the somewhat unromantic condition.s, the mechanic more than made up for it as he made his vows. 
He told Robert: "I, Aaron Dingle, take you, Robert Jacob Sugden, to be my wedded husband. I can't really think of anything else to say. Sorry, I'm rubbish at this. But you know. 
"I've never had this with anyone else before. I never thought I'd have this with anyone. I never thought I'd have it with you. And now I've gone and messed it all up. 
"I promise to be better as well. To trust you. To never let you down ever again. I promise I'm going to be the best husband I can be." 
Robert then promised Aaron: "I take you, Aaron Dingle, to be my wedded husband. I promise to be faithful, to put you first, to make you happy, to keep trying to be better for you - because you deserve it." 
Those tuning in were overcome with emotion and were quick to take to Twitter afterwards to shower the show with praise. 
One wrote: "Sitting here crying at emmerdale again I lead such a fun life." 
Another then added: "I'll wait for ya' 'then you'll come home to me' I HAVE TEARS STREAMING #Emmerdale #RobronWedding." 
Moments later, a different viewer wrote: "You've just got to love #robron! #Emmerdale goes from strength to strength." In true Robron style, the couple decided to go against tradition and exchange their vows in a very unusual place - a garage (Photo: ITV) 
Shortly afterwards, another tweeted: "Saw! #robron making me all emosh! Good job @emmerdale." 
Unfortunately for fans, the couple's happiness will be short lived as Aaron will be heading to prison next week. 
We've heard he'll be spending a year behind bars - will the couple survive so long apart? 
*Emmerdale returns to ITV on Monday at 7pm Like us on Facebook
